author: cmpilato
msg: Teach 'svn commit' to handle multiple changelists.
While here, make 'svn commit --changelist foo' stop whining when it
finds nothing to commit.  Not only is this (in my opinion) a silly
reason to error out (a filter that filters everything is doing its
job, not some fatal condition), but the error bogusly claimed the
changelist wasn't found, which is flatly untrue (it might just be that
none of the items in the changelist had local modifications).  I'll
reopen issue #2880 so this can be re-addressed, though, if folks feel
the need.
* subversion/include/svn_client.h
(svn_client_commit4): Trade 'changelist_name' for a list of
'changelists'.  Rename 'keep_changelist' to 'keep_changelists'.
* subversion/libsvn_client/client.h
(svn_client__harvest_committables): Trade 'changelist_name' for a list of
'changelists'.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit_util.c
(considered_committable): Trade 'changelist_name' for a hash whose
keys are changelist names, and fix the logic in the obvious ways.
(harvest_committables): Trade 'changelist_name' for a hash
'changelists' whose keys are changelist names.  Update calls to
considered_committable().
(svn_client__harvest_committables): Trade 'changelist_name' for a list of
'changelists'.  Update calls to harvest_committables(), passing
the result of an array-to-hash conversion of 'changelists'.  Also,
don't error out when the changelist filter finds nothing to commit.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit.c
(struct post_commit_baton): Rename 'keep_changelist' to 'keep_changelists'.
(svn_client_commit4): Trade 'changelist_name' for a list of
'changelists'.  Rename 'keep_changelist' to 'keep_changelists'.
Update call to svn_client__harvest_committables().
* subversion/svn/commit-cmd.c
(svn_cl__commit): Update call to svn_client_commit4(), passing a
list of changelists instead of only a single one.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/commit_tests.py
(no_such_changelist): Removed.
(test_list): Remove reference to no_such_changelist().

author: cmpilato
msg: Update changelist TODO list.

author: pburba
msg: Fix for issue #2997 "If skipped paths come first in operative merge,
mergeinfo is incomplete"
This fixes some inconsistencies which can occur when in the way mergeinfo is
recorded if multiple editor drives are required to complete a merge.
Previously, if X discontinuous ranges were merged, and the first N ( < X) of
these were inoperative, the mergeinfo for those first N ranges was not added
to the updated mergeinfo.  But any inoperative ranges applied *after* at
least one operative range were included.  Now all ranges are included
regardless of when the first operative range is encountered.  Of course if
*all* the ranges are inoperative the mergeinfo is not changed (i.e. the fix
for issue #2883 still holds).
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(working_mergeinfo_t): New, a wrapper around svn_string_t to store in a
hash (allows us to store NULL values in the hash too).
(merge_cmd_baton_t): Remove 'override_set' member, it is no longer needed.
Add 'first_range' and 'working_mergeinfo' members.  Tweak comment for
existing 'pool' member, noting it's lifetime is limited to individual
editor drives.  Add member 'long_pool' that exists across editor drives.
(determine_merges_performed): Always calculate the merges performed, even
if this particular drive is a no-op, subsequent drives might not be.  Don't
attempt to set override mergeinfo on unversioned obstructions.  If the
target of a merge has no working mergeinfo prior to a merge, note that in
the new 'working_mergeinfo' member in the merge command baton.
(update_wc_mergeinfo): Don't try to update mergeinfo for missing or
obstructed directory paths.
(get_mergeinfo_walk_baton): Add 'first_range', working_mergeinfo' and
'long_pool' members.  These are cascaded from the new merge_cmd_baton_t
members of the same names.
(get_mergeinfo_walk_cb): Initialize the new 'working_mergeinfo' member of
merge_cmd_baton_t for directory merges.
(get_mergeinfo_paths): Cascade new merge_cmd_baton_t members to
get_mergeinfo_walk_cb baton.  Remove initialization of deprecated
'override_set' member of merge_cmd_baton_t.
(do_file_merge): Initialize the new 'working_mergeinfo' member of
merge_cmd_baton_t for file merges.
(do_directory_merge): Remove code that tries to determine if this an
opertative merge or not and subsequently tries to remove override
mergeinfo, there is insufficient information at this point to know that.
Just go ahead and always update the mergeinfo, if this ultimately ends up
a no-op merge we remove these changes in do_merge().
(do_merge): Initialize new members of merge_cmd_baton_t.  Restore working
mergeinfo if this merge is ultimately a no-op.
* subversion/libsvn_client/mergeinfo.h
(svn_client__merge_path_t): Remove the 'propval' member used to track
working mergeinfo.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_authz_tests.py
(mergeinfo_and_skipped_paths): Tack on a test for issue #2997 to this
existing test.

author: kameshj
msg: Fix wrong parameter name in the doc string.
* subversion/include/svn_ra.h
(svn_ra_get_session_url): Replace repos_URL -> url in the doc string.

author: dongsheng
msg: * tools/po/po-update.sh:
Remove 'function' keyword for sh-compatible.
Add '--no-wrap' to msgmerge, minimize spurious diffs.
Approved by: dlr
